comment: She is very kind and caring and she genuinely cares about the students. Her lectures are very helpful and she's very open-minded. She loves participation and her assignments are very easy. The "hardest" assignment was an essay that does require the textbook, you can find it online. Honestly, one of my favorite professors I've ever had.

the 7 week class was not too bad. you do have to stay on track DAILY with assignments. there was lots of reading to do and reading worksheets, but it was all easy. she is not a tough grader so you honestly just have to do the work. i missed a few reading worksheets and still passed with an A. there are discussions that are lengthy but easy take her
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Probably THE easiest class at KSU. It is very difficult to fail this class. Online, 7 week course. Do the assignments on time and follow the syllabus; you can easily pass this class with a 100%. Extremely interesting topics and the final was optional! She is a bit slow when grading, so bare with her, but she responds to emails in a timely manner.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: This was an online seven week course and there was 3 reading worksheets, & 1 discussion due every week, so in total 21 reading worksheets & 7 discussions. This class was a very easy A. I do not recommend buying the book since she gives you a summary on it already & you can also find summaries online. Tons of work but doesn't grade too heavy.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is so sweet and amazing! She is completely understanding of your schedule and if your computer buggs out. The assignments are extremely interesting and non-time consuming. She asks for the small amount of time out of all my online professors. I recommend her class, while I would not say it is an easy A, it certainly is not a difficult one.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Easy A if you keep up with the hw. I took the 7 week class in May and there was an assignment due almost every night. 3 readings and response pages, and one 250 word discussion post and two 250 word disscussion post responses a week. If you do them on time you get a 100%.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: This was one of my easiest classes this semester. It was 100% online. The class was easy because it consisted of weekly reading worksheet assignments and a discussion post for every unit. The final was optional and she gives alot of extra credit opportunities. Make sure to read the syllabus! It is also important to get the textbook.

This was one of my easiest classes this semester. It was 100% online. Although Professor Keltner can be hard to contact, the class was easy because it consisted of weekly reading worksheet assignments and a discussion post for every unit. The final was option and she gives alot of extra credit opportunities. Make sure to read the syllabus!

keltner's class isn't difficult, but it is work heavy. typically 3 reading worksheets and a discussion post over a 2 week period. prof, keltner didn't give any tests or quizzes, and our final ended up being optional. it's heavy on the reading, but again not difficult at all and easily manageable! i would take this class again!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: She is a nice professor. Very friendly. However, there is just way too much busy work. 2-3 reading worksheets per week and a discussion post every other week. They have to be 250 words and 2 responses that are 250 words each. Doesn't seem like much, but when you're balancing 5 other classes, it's very time consuming to spend hours on this class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took this class online as an elective to meet the minimum hour requirement for HOPE and Im glad I took it. It was a very interesting class. Her grading criteria and course outline is VERY clear. She grades fairly and gave us several opportunities for extra credit. Shes also very easy to contact! I definitely recommend taking this class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The notes are just paragraphs and paragraphs of nonsense. She cannot dumb it down, per say. She essentially writes essays for us to read and that is our notes for that section. There is no book. There is no powerpoint. Literally just long paragraphs about a topic. Very hard to learn anything at all. I don't think she really cares about learning
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Took online, but she seems so sweet and helpful. Quizzes every week and every 3 chapters there is a discussion. You can find a downloadable version of the book online. It is helpful to read along, but after the first chapter I skimmed. Minimal effort to get an A but don't take it for granted. Do your assignments on time every week.

Gives a quiz every week over the chapters and sometimes a discussion post instead. You use the book for the quiz's but I didn't buy it because all the answers can be found on Quizlet. She's a great professor and very passionate about the topics if you take her for a class that interests you and not a gen ed. Gives an extra credit paper too.

Not a tough grader at all as long as you answer the questions clearly from discussions and respond to your peers. Quizzes are easy since she posts PowerPoints that summarize the main points of the book. I took her online but she seems really nice!

GREAT professor! Be sure to read the weekly mods and you will be solid on all of the quizzes. Took her online in the summer and she spaced out the work but kept us on schedule. One main exam, which was the final. She did allow extra credit. A few discussion posts and multiple quizzes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Pretty easy A. The first 3 quizzes are hard, but after that they're easy As. I didnt even read the book I just read her powerpoints. She is a lenient grader on the discussions as I never got lower than a 100. She also offers an extra credit 1200 word paper (which I believe if you do you should have no problem getting an A). I recommend her

Not an easy class or easy grade, but totally worth it. Professor Keltner covers material that will challenge your own ideas and understandings. Lots of tough material (scholarly journals, long essays, etc) in this course, but it never felt overwhelming. The work you do is designed to help you comprehend the material. Take her.

Gender studies is my minor. I took my first course last semester. I aced it, but did not like the teacher and was going to drop it as my minor and take something else. Professor K changed my mind. She is a great teacher, a caring teacher, but she isn't easy. You will work for it - and be all the better for it. Trust me. She's AMAZING!
Online summer course is tough. Required discussion posts and responses must be thorough. Quizzes are very hard. Extra credit opportunity worth the time. Earned a high A but had to work for it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Great professor!! The class is very psychology based rather than what you think it would be. Quizzes are very unclear and often I thought there was more than one right answer.. I made an A in the class though. You just gotta read a lot and write mini essays for the discussions every week. Topic is interesting though and I really did learn from it!

The book for this is not a textbook, but rather an opinion bases chapter book. It is extremely confusing and the quizzes that go with each chapter are not clearly written and are opinion based from the author. They are very very tough. Two quizzes or 1 quiz and discussion post each week. Way to difficult for a general education class.

You have to read the book and take the material seriously. She breaks down the book into sections- first three chapters will have quizzes and then an overall discussion post that is a critical response to her question asked. Final exam which is two essay questions, outside book reading and paper. She takes this class seriously and expects the same.

Professor Keltner was great. I would definitely take her again because she cares for her students and she wants you to do well. I took her online which consisted of good amount of reading, homework, and one big or two small papers. I think she gave a fair amount of work and as long as you show effort and turn things in on time, you will be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: This is the easiest class I've taken at KSU. She is very helpful and provides great feedback. YOU NEED THE BOOK. 5 quizzes, 9 discussions and respond to two of your classmates and 1 exam!   1 essay about your volunteer work ( she requires 10 hrs) don't wait till the last minute to do it. Easy A do the work and you'll pass!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: She's SO NICE!!

Doctor Keltner was easily the best professor I have had for an online course! The topics discussed can be a little awkward when writing discussions and she understands that so she's helpful. Theres one module a week which is either a discussion or a quiz. You will need the book for the quizzes but she posts a powerpoint too which helps a lot!

While the tests are a bit difficult, I highly recommend taking Professor Keltner! She truly cares about the students and wants you to do the best you can in her class! Just make sure you read the chapters and you will do great!
If you want an easy A, take this class. Each week you have a quiz and every three weeks or so you just have a discussion. She gives hints on her quizzes too.

Dr. Kelter is awesome! The assignments, readings and expectations are very clear. She gives clear feedback and let's you know exactly what your opportunities are. Don't be fooled and think that just because this is an online class that she is not reading discussion posts. She reads every single posts and provides individual feedback.

Took the hybrid class. As long as you read the book , take the quizzes, and write decent papers you'll be set. Class is spent talking in small groups, which can be kind of boring after awhile, but overall a good, easy class.

Going into this class I thought it was going to be difficult, but it ended up being a super easy A. I took it as hybrid & the classes were boring and sometimes awkward, but she did admit to normally doing online. You have papers instead of tests which she grades very easy. Quizzes over chpts but follow her power points and she gives exact answers.

She's nice, and the coursework is minimal, but don't take her class if you actually want the experience of a love and sex class. The minimal work is all online and class meetings are reserved for talking in groups about the book chapters. Plus, she cancels most in class meetings. Very boring and feels like a waste of what little time I do spend.

Very easy but, very BORING. Consists of reading the book, taking quizzes about the book, and then going to class to talk about the book. But, there are no tests just papers. You usually get pared into a group to talk for the entire class about things you have already read and taken the quiz on. If you want an easy class then this is it.
Not easy, but worth it.

Dr. Keltner is easily one of the best professors at KSU. Her classes are difficult only because of the material, and she makes it easier to understand. She only does hybrids, I think, and the in-class meetings are rare, but they are some of the best lectures  you can receive at this school. She is definitely worth taking for any class.
Dr. Keltner seems to favor online or hybrid classes, which is truly a shame, because she's really amazing in class.

Don't take her online, she doesn't teach. She gives you readings, has you read her review of the readings then you post some discussion postings then take a test.  I didnt learn a thing from this class and she grades hard.  Perhaps she's different in class, but as for online, stay away, I was worried I would fail this class.

This teacher is wonderful! I can't wait to take her class again! Shs is very helpful and you can always reach her by phone or e-mail. She made this class very interesting and I looked forward to it everyday. I never missed a class. Her material isnt hard but you have to apply yourself because Philosophy in general is hard. TAKE HER IF YOU CAN!!

very hard class, definitely challenges you to think.  i had her while she was on maternity leave so the rest of the class was online.  if you are taking her online, make sure u post discussions on time and know ahead of time that little skimpy paragraphs will get u nowhere.  she wants to see that u can think critically.  great professor though.

Philosophy is one of the weirdest classes I've taken at KSU. It definitely challenges you to think. This was by no means an easy "A" class. It definitely required extensive reading, studying, and comprehension. I had her while she was on maternity leave so she was very understannding to late assignments and easy grading. She made the final optional

Dr. Keltner is very knowledgeable about Greek philosophy and she makes it extremely clear about what's expected for her tests. Write everything down, study it, and be able to write an exam-style essay about it. She's comes off as rather impersonal, but she'll like you if she thinks that you're a decent person.

Dr. Keltner is a wonderful woman.  She is very helpful and curves the grades pretty well.  I was worried about a C and ended up with an A.  She really knows her subject.  She is a brilliant woman and keeps the class interesting even if you are not interested in the topic.
She is a great teacher and very helpful.

One of my favorite profs. She is incredibly intelligent and relates a difficult subject to modern-day applications very well. She will curve grade upward if you put forth effort and discussion in class.

She is one of the best professors ever!  You must take notes and pay attention in every class to keep up though.  She is willing in every way to help in any way she can!  As long as you put the effort in, the class is fun and interesting!  Basically, she ROCKS!

totally kick ass teacher. only hard if you can't think outside the box. i got extremely high A's on my last like 5 assignments (including tests, final, and term paper) and it's a really fun course. and on top of that she looks like kristen bell omg.

totally excellent class. didn't do great in the first part but i wasn't interested but into modern philo it was amazing. great teacher, very clear and smart and a total babe. she is a tough grader but she will teach you exactly what you need..just get a grip on it and you'll be fine.

This class id hard. Take notes, READ the assignments!Her test are like 5 short eassays. Hard. But if you do bad on 1, there are like 6 tests in the class total so you can bring it up. Attendance is 10% of your grade. Shes really really distractingly attractive.

dr. keltner is amazing, she is tough only because of the density of the subject matter.  i enjoyed the class and she is very helpful with trying to find topical informationthat works with your interests.
